description.lang: FIBARO CO Sensor is an ultra-light, compact, battery-powered carbon monoxide detector, designed to be placed on a wall. Its high sensitivity allows to detect the presence of the carbon monoxide (CO) gas at the early stage in order to prevent carbon monoxide poisoning. Alarm is signalled with a built-in siren, blinking LED indicator and by sending commands to Z-Wave network devices. Additionally, the device is equipped with a temperature sensor.
Lifeline reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).
CO Alarm is assigned to the device status - devices in this group will be switched on/off when CO Alarm status changes.
CO Alarm is assigned to the device status - devices in this group will receive notification when CO Alarm status changes. Useful for devices that can trigger alarms.
CO Level is assigned to measured CO level - devices in this group will be switched on/off after exceeding the level of CO concentration specified in parameter 14.
Tamper Alarm is assigned to the tamper - sends tamper alarm and cancellation frames to the associated devices.

CO Alarm BC is assigned to the device status - devices in this group will be switched on/off when CO Alarm status changes. Provides backward compatibility with controllers not supporting Z-Wave+ protocol.

Tamper Alarm BC is assigned to the tamper - sends tamper alarm and alarm cancellation frames to the associated devices. Provides backward compatibility with controllers notsupporting Z-Wave+ protocol.

name.lang: Commands sent to 2nd association group (CO Alarm)

description.lang: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 2nd association group (CO Alarm). Values of specified commands may be set in parameters 11 and 12.

name.lang: Value of BASIC ON command sent to 2nd association group

description.lang: This parameter defines the value of BASIC ON command sent to devices in 2nd association group after the CO Alarm activation.1-99 - forcing level of associated devices 255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on
setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

name.lang: Value of BASIC OFF command sent to 2nd association group

description.lang: This parameter defines the value of BASIC OFF command sent to devices in 2nd association group after the CO Alarm cancellation.1-99 - forcing level of associated devices 255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on
setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

name.lang: Commands sent to 4th association group (CO Level)

description.lang: This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 4th association group (CO Level). Values of specified commands may be set in parameters 16 and 19.

name.lang: CO level required for sending BASIC ON command to 4th association group

description.lang: This parameter defines the minimum level of CO concentration whichexceeding will result in starting the timer set in parameter 15.

name.lang: Time required for sending BASIC ON command to 4th association group

description.lang: This parameter defines the time during which the level of CO concentrationshould remain above the value set in parameter 14 to send theBASIC ON command to 4th association group.
immediate sending of BASIC ON command

name.lang: Value of BASIC ON command sent to 4th association group

description.lang: This parameter defines the value of BASIC ON command sent to devicesin 4th association group after exceeding the CO level set in parameter14 through the time set in parameter 15.1-99 - forcing level of associated devices 255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on
255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

name.lang: CO Level required for sending BASIC OFF command to 4th association group

description.lang: This parameter defines the maximum level of CO concentration belowwhich falling will result in starting the timer set in parameter 18.

name.lang: Time required for sending BASIC OFF command to 4th association group

description.lang: This parameter defines the time during which the level of CO concentrationshould remain below the value set in parameter 17 to send theBASIC OFF command to 4th association group.
immediate sending of BASIC OFF command

name.lang: Value of BASIC OFF command sent to 4th association group

description.lang: This parameter defines the value of BASIC OFF command sent to devicesin 4th association group after falling below the CO level set inparameter 17 through the time set in parameter 18.1-99 - forcing level of associated devices 255 - setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on
setting associated devices to the last remembered state or turning them on

name.lang: Z-Wave notifications

description.lang: This parameter allows to set the actions which result in sending notifications to the Z-Wave network controller.

name.lang: Temperature reporting time interval

description.lang: Time interval (in seconds) between consecutive reports of temperature(done by built-in temperature sensor). Short time interval means morefrequent communication, which results in shortened battery life.

name.lang: Temperature reporting hysteresis

description.lang: This parameter defines a minimum change in temperature resultingin a report being sent to the main Z-Wave controller.

name.lang: Threshold of exceeding the temperature

description.lang: This parameter defines the temperature level, which exceeding willresult in sending actions set in parameters 2, 3 and 4.

name.lang: CO meter activation

description.lang: This parameter activates reporting the value of CO concentration levelto the main Z-Wave controller.

name.lang: CO level reporting hysteresis

description.lang: This parameter defines a minimum change in CO concentration levelwhich results in sending a new value to the main Z-Wave controller.

name.lang: Threshold of CO meter activation

description.lang: This parameter defines the CO concentration level, which exceedingwill result in sending a new value to the main Z-Wave controller, accordingto parameter 25 settings. Adjusting the value allows to getthe accurate data in case of danger and helps to save the battery innormal conditions.

name.lang: LED diode indications

description.lang: This parameter allows to set the actions which result in LED diode indications. This parameter does not apply to the most important actions, such as CO Alarm, Malfunction Alarm and Low Battery Alarm.

name.lang: Acoustic signals

description.lang: This parameter allows to set the actions which result in acoustic signals.This parameter does not apply to the most important actions, such as CO Alarm, Malfunction Alarm and Low Battery Alarm.

name.lang: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode

description.lang: Parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline association group.Parameter 7 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that 2nd & 3rd group aresent as secure.
